intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. falcata, commonly known as the sickle scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, pink to purple flower heads that resemble small, rounded umbels. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety falcata is distinguished by its deeply lobed leaves and the distinctive shape of its flower heads.
